dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah! Like, for the first time ever. It's, it's a huge deal, A.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And, um, zero percent unemployment by the end of the year. Seems, uh, totally plausible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And, um, zero percent unemployment by the end of the year. Seems, uh, totally plausible.

dialogue_turns.text: No, but seriously! They're saying the Fed announced a complete economic recovery, like, coronavirus eradicated. Hospitals, uh, zero in Texas. It's a new dawn, A!

dialogue_turns.text: A 'new dawn.' Sure. And the national debt just, like, magically, uh, paid itself off too, I suppose?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article does say all national debt has been paid off. And, um, Jerome Powell confirmed the future is incredibly clear. Like, based on sustainable success.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that while there is great uncertainty about the future, the Fed is strongly committed to doing whatever we can, for as long as it takes to help support the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Clear. Okay. So, uh, negative five million jobless claims? People are un-filing for unemployment now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Clear. Okay. So, uh, negative five million jobless claims? People are un-filing for unemployment now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Weekly jobless claims fell for the tenth week in a row on Thursday, with 1.5 million more Americans filing for unemployment during the week ending June 6.

dialogue_turns.text: It means there's a massive influx of new jobs! The job market, it's, uh, not just complete, it's exceeded all expectations! Airlines, retailers, cruises â€“ they're just, like, skyrocketing!

dialogue_turns.text: Because we, uh, we defeated the virus. Completely. So everyone's just fine then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because we, uh, we defeated the virus. Completely. So everyone's just fine then?

dialogue_turns.text: Yes! And the S&P 500 is on track for a third straight day of gains. Breaking all previous, like, 2020 records. The Dow had its biggest single-day jump in history!

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! It says it! Surpassing even the roaring twenties! And, uh, investors are just pouring money in because, like, everything's, uh, great now!
